question: It is true that User Management allows creating, modifying, and deleting user accounts.
It is false that the OS does not control what users can do on a system.
User Management helps prevent unauthorized access to a system.
It is false that in Windows, the Device Manager is used to manage user accounts.
User Management allows multiple users to have personalized settings on the same system.
It is true that Security Policies help protect the system from threats like hacking and malware.
It is false that security policies do not include enforcing password rules.
A strong security policy helps prevent unauthorized users from accessing the system.
It is true that an account may get locked after multiple failed login attempts due to security policies.
It is false that firewalls do not help in protecting a system from harmful network connections.
Security policies help in password management and account security.
It is false that a user with an admin account cannot install software on a system.
Device Management is responsible for handling hardware devices connected to the system.
It is false that printers, USB drives, and keyboards are not part of device management.
The OS installs and updates drivers to ensure proper communication between devices and the system.
It is false that Device Management is only required for external hardware and not internal components.
In Windows, Device Manager allows users to enable or disable devices.
It is true that Linux users can use the 'lsusb' command to list connected USB devices.
Performance Monitor helps in checking CPU, memory, and network usage.
It is false that Performance Monitor is not useful for identifying slow applications.
Windows Task Manager can show real-time CPU and memory usage.
It is false that Linux has no tools like Task Manager to monitor system performance.
The 'top' command in Linux displays real-time CPU and memory usage.
It is true that if a program is using too much RAM, it can slow down the system.
It is false that performance monitoring tools cannot be used to close unresponsive applications.
Task Scheduler allows users to automate tasks such as system updates and backups.
It is false that Task Scheduler can only run tasks manually and not at a scheduled time.
Cron jobs in Linux are used for scheduling automated tasks.
It is false that Task Scheduler cannot be used to shut down a computer automatically.
It is true that users can schedule antivirus scans using Task Scheduler.
It is false that OS tools do not help in managing computer performance.
A security policy may include firewall settings to block harmful connections.
It is false that only administrators can change security policies.
User Management helps in assigning different permissions to different users.
It is false that a computer system can function well without device management.
Performance monitoring tools help detect system slowdowns caused by high resource usage.
It is false that Task Scheduler is only useful for businesses and not for individual users.
Security policies may require users to change their passwords periodically.
It is false that antivirus programs are not part of security policies.
Device Management helps the OS recognize new hardware when connected.
It is false that OS tools have no role in system maintenance.
User Management allows setting restrictions on how users interact with the system.
It is false that performance monitoring tools cannot show disk activity.
Task Scheduler helps ensure that important tasks run even if the user forgets.
It is false that all OS tools must be manually operated every time.
Security policies can include rules for data encryption.
It is false that the OS does not need to manage user access levels.
Performance Monitor helps identify potential security threats from suspicious programs.
It is false that an OS can function without any security policies.
Device Management includes managing both input and output devices.
